text: A near-open vowel (or a near-low vowel) is a vowel sound used in some spoken languages. The meaning of a near-open vowel is that the tongue is positioned the same as an open vowel, but slightly more narrow. ==List== The near-open vowels with these symbols in the International Phonetic Alphabet are: * near- open front unrounded vowel * near-open central vowel (mostly used as unrounded) Other near-open vowels can have marks on letters of relative articulation applied to neighboring vowels, such as and for near-open, near- back, rounded and unrounded vowels. == References == Category:Vowels
title: Near-open vowel
